metadata.title: CVE-2016-4658 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
xpointer.c in libxml2 before 2.9.5 (as used in Apple iOS before 10, OS Xbefore 10.12, tvOS before 10, and watchOS before 3, and other products)does not forbid namespace nodes in XPointer ranges, which allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(use-after-free and memory corruption) via a crafted XML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2').
